tripleplay.util

Class Tapper

  • java.lang.Object
    • tripleplay.util.Tapper
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Pointer.Listener
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    DoubleTapper

    public class Tapper
extends Object
implements Pointer.Listener
    Detects taps on a layer. This is a simple implementation using a threshold distance. If the pointer is dragged less than the threshold, a call to onTap(Events.Position) is generated.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static float DEFAULT_TAP_DIST
      Default threshold distance.
      static float DEFAULT_TAP_DIST_SQ
      Default threshold distance, set to DEFAULT_TAP_DIST squared.
      float maxTapDistSq
      Square of the threshold distance for this tapper, defaults to DEFAULT_TAP_DIST_SQ.

    • Method Detail

      • onTap

        public void onTap()
        Called when a tap occurs. This is a simpler version of onTap(Events.Position), for subclasses that don't require the event position.

      • onTap

        public void onTap(Events.Position where)
        Called when a tap occurs. By default, this just calls onTap(). Subclasses overriding needn't call super.
        Parameters:
        where - the pointer's end position
